text: I ordered the Pho Dac Biet #90 XL. It was surely a good portion size and filled me up quick. The sides were fresh and plenty of sauce options. We were there on a Thursday at around midnight and the restaurant was busy to my surprise. Will visit again!

Best pho I have had anywhere. If you are in Vegas make your way over to this little restaurant in Chinatown.  I would've liked a couple more visits to explore the menu.  I had the spring rolls which were great.  Also they have a dish with a pork chop marinated for 24 (or 48 I don't remember the exact time frame) hours and served in rice that is excellent! But the Pho is the real star in this place.  There are SO many Pho places in Vegas to choose from- I was glad I ended up in this one.
The Pho was great and the soup had a great flavor. Spring rolls are awesome. Recommend to everyone

Hier wird wirklich frisch gekocht.sehr freundliche Bedienung. begeistert haben uns auch die frischen Zutaten feine Basilikumblätter Sprossen und ähnliches. das Lokal ist innen viel gemütlicher als es von außen wirkt. sehr gute Würzung auch gibt es alle möglichen Zutaten am Tisch. wir haben uns wohl gefühlt

This is actually, the only restaurant out of the hundreds I been, that I love the service, server My was amazing, food was great, we didn't have to wait that long, or called her to get more water, she was very friendly, I highly recommend this place, not only cause the food is great but the service also.
Awesome food. Friendly servers. The pho is delicious. Not too salty and the spring rolls are delicious ...I had the pork... looking forward to trying a different type next time I'm here :-)

This place is a must stop. Anytime is a great time for Pho. The broth is tasty and the atmosphere is nice and the workers are great. 
Tasty Too

Pho is really good.
I like it. I will come back soon from LA.

I found this place from Yelp, the rating was great.
We got the table, got water and order placed.
40 minutes passed by, I started to get really frustrated. We asked for food multiple times and the server confirmed that food will be ready shortly. Another server came and asked us to confirm our orders. Excuse me??!!!
I could not believe what I just heard...
Long story short, we didn't get our full orders, had to asked for vegetables for Phos after we got noodles.. food was decent but the service, big question mark...
Had the rice plate that was super delicious. Tried some of the pho which was on point too.

This place used to deserve 5 stars even 10. Every time we're in Vegas which is almost every month. I made sure to go there because it was one of the best pho we have ever tasted.  Their sandwiches were exceptionally delicious too that I would take 3-5 sandwiches back to LA. Last month I was a little disappointed with their sandwich it didn't taste the same and the service was exceptionally slow but I let that pass. But my trip yesterday was something else. The sandwich was so dry. To top it all off the server was so rude this lady with long black hair need la to go back and take  a 101 customer service class. We came in didn't acknowledge us then it took her 10 minutes to give the menu even if there were a few people only. Another 15 minutes to bring the water. When she came I said we were ready to order she just said "ok" goes back to register drinks water goes to the bathroom then back to the register then the kitchen. When we ready to pay my husband goes to the register to pay she says the same thing "ok" but then instead of getting our money. She gets a straw brings it another table goes back walks around. Goes to the kitchen gets stuff and after several times going back and forth for another 15 minutes she calls another girl in the kitchen to get out payment because she can't touch the register.

ok so let me just lead by saying my palate is really thrown off since my sinuses are so congested. the service here is quick and painless. the server was very attentive to both cleanliness and customers. 

i ordered my food and drink, and while waiting, was served jasmine tea. maybe a minute or two after i got the tea my order was in front of me. the chicken pho was... alright. The broth was a bit too salty for me and the chicken wasn't tender or very flavorful. however, doctor it up with some lime and hoisin (among other condiments) and things started to come together. they didn't have boba at the time, so i opted for the jelly with banana smoothie. it tastes like bananas you buy from the store, not the artificial flavoring like from runts candy, and has just the right consistency between icy and creamy. 

i left satisfied with the experience, but not running to tell all my friends about this spot. maybe it's just the chicken pho- the bahn mi i saw while closing out looked fantastic and the seafood pho is appealing, so I'll consider returning for those some day.

We found this place through Yelp, we were looking for a place with good food and away from the strip. 
This place is small and intimate, very clean. We were very impressed by the service and attention from the staff, who took the time to explain the menu and made great suggestions on what to try. We were not disappointed. The pho was great, amazing flavor, and very much a great value. This place is highly recommended.

I had a take out order for a bun bowl (b1) but when I got to my car, I realized that they gave me pho (p1). Totally understood, simple mistake. I've worked the service industry before and I usually don't complain about this stuff anyways. I went back and the gal that took my order was super apologetic and I appreciated that. There was a very kind and personable lady who I assume was either the owner or manager there. I didn't know if there was a price difference but I offered to pay it if there was. She told me that it was fine and that my order would be out shortly. It was pretty late and I could tell that she was on her way out but she stayed until I got my food. Very nice staff and great food. I will definitely come back when I'm back in town.

Had a craving for pho and saw the reviews on yelp and had to try. Serving speed a little slow, but you can see they were trying. Pho was good. Soup stock was decent. Lots of meat and noodles, but gotta say the meat was maybe too healthy, as it was a little dry.  Still good though. Thai iced tea was good too. Waitress was very cute. #niceshoes

Pretty good place I recently visited. Went there for dinner with a friend and they had a really cool cooking show on the TV. Great staff, not too crowded and in a really good complex, tea station is down the street. Great date spot.

Customer services was horrible, she never came to the table asking how's everything nor re fills on drinks, towards the end there was a bug supposedly a "fly" from what the host was saying, but it never flew?? Never again

Casual environment, Great food, nice presentation, and good service. The waitress was very friendly.

Spring Rolls and egg rolls were good.

This is the best authentic Vietnamese restaurant I've ever had in terms of taste, quality, quantity, service and cleanliness... it's hard to find a restaurant with all these combination. I'm surprise there's not a lot more review... Their bun bo hue and pho is soooo good. I love pho and usually is very picky on my pho taste bc I grew up eating it. This place definitely nailed it. We also order a beef chow fun, not a viet dish, but surprisingly it tasted better then the real authentic chinese restaurant. Wish I can stay on vegas longer just to come back to this place!
Best service and the best food ever, we're here every Thursday  P1 is good specially the soup

Service was great! Lady was super nice and even with her limited English we still understood each other. I enjoyed my pho dac biet and the price was pretty good. They were having a discount when we went, but I's still return even without the discount.
Great and authentic pho. Very reasonable price , far better than any fast food on stripe.
Came here to try the Pho and I was not disappointed! Ordered the Chicken pho and it had good flavors. The portion size is huge. The service however is very slow.

There's something different about the broth here that stands out. We ordered the chicken and beef pho soup. The first thing you'll notice is the extreme clarity of the broth. There is a layer of grease, but that's really gelatin from the bones and it's actually very good for you. Don't season the soup with any hoison or siracha sauce. Oh yeah, the soup tastes delicious too :-)

Finally another Vietnamese restaurant that's open late!

DRINK: They have a really big drink menu offering sodas, tea, coffee, smoothies, and authentic Vietnamese desserts.

FOOD: The food here tastes different than other Vietnamese restaurants. I mean that in good way! All their dishes are freshly made and you can taste it. A lot of Vietnamese restaurants are known for processed foods and msg in their dishes, but Pho 90 is not one of those restaurants which I really appreciate. Their Chicken Pho was absolutely delicious. Some recommendations: I think they can add more green onions on top to add color to the presentation of the food, they should offer white or dark meat for the Chicken Pho because I prefer dark meat, and they should offer larger or small bowls because the size they gave me was way too big for me. Their Spring Rolls were delicious, only critique is that some of the veggies they put into the roll was getting brown so they should sort their veggies better. I will definitely be back to try more food here!

ATMOSPHERE: I've gone to every restaurant that has been in this place before Pho 90 opened and it seems that every owner keep the same tables and decor. The server was really friendly and eager to hear our feedback on their food. They are attentive to their customers.
Went there twice in a roll, very large portion of its signature bowl, cannot finish at all. Good taste, reasonable price, great services, a good choice for pho lovers.

Food was good no complaints there. Server was a bit inattentive and distracted. She was the only one working and looked like she had many other duties to take care of than just serving. I would still go back.

I'm back for a second time, the following morning from my first visit.  I usually go down the street to another pho restaurant but saw the reviews here and thought I'd give it a try.  I had the Pho Tai and grilled pork spring rolls.  The pho was so good, I thought I was back in Garden Grove at my favorite pho place, it's that good.  The broth has a really good flavor, noodles cooked perfectly, nice serving of rare steak.  The spring rolls were some of the best I've had, the grilled pork had so much flavor, nice peanut sauce too.  I'm getting the same thing this morning, waiting for them to open.

I'm from Los Angeles and let me tell you...the pho here is FLIGHT. It's a small cozy restaurant but their pho broth packs so much flavor, no need to add anything but a few jalapeño slices for some spice. So glad my friends and I stumbled upon this place... it will most definitely be our go to pho spot in Vegas. 

The server/cashier was really sweet and service was great.

We love love absolutely love this little place!! It's our new favorite pho spot!  The staff is super friendly,  and our orders always come out fast!

We always get the #13 (Rare beef noodle soup)  

Stay awesome Pho 90, and you will have our business for life!

So delicious! This place has a nice seating area and the staff is very friendly. I recommend coming here if you are staying in The Rio or some off strip hotel nearby. Parking is a little tight but it is available astound back as well. Yum!
Best real pho in Vegas. Great service, you know if you go with bunch of Koreans they need double of every side dish. Will definitely come here every time I visit Vegas

I went there based on the Yelp ratings.  The staff were friendly and prompt in their service.  The Thai Tea was delicious as was the grilled pork and rice.  The food and atmosphere were so good I was prompted to pay for a stranger's meal as well.  I will go back whenever I get the chance!

It's pretty tasty Pho. I have eaten here a couple times. The first time the broth had some beef grease which I love, more of a home style pho. The second time the broth was clean, but still both times super hot and flavorful. The only thing I think they need to work on is meat portion, my bowl had a little more of one type of meat than another. I do understand food cost but don't skimp on the certain cut of meat you like. Anyway service is as expected from a Vietnamese mom and pop joint but what can you do? The Pho is tasty and legit here. My only other critique they should use bigger fried egg roll shells, make them bigger and they'll probably sell more egg rolls. Overall decent pho, decent prices and good mom and pop joint. Just bring back the grease. Pho is healthy enough.

Pho 90 is definitely a contender for best pho in Vegas. 

They have the big noodle and its fresh and light. The soup is perfectly seasoned, not to salty. The meat is high quality. It cooks just right in the soup, not too chewy. 

In my 3yrs or trying Vegas pho, this will be my new go to spot.

Excellent service!!. The owner/cashier/waiter is the same person that does it all. He introduced himself after we were seated. He his very accommodating but the food need more TLC to compete with their competitors. I ordered large pho but a bit shy on the noodles and beef, and soup base was little bland. Since service was great, I Will visit again to try their other items in the menu.

Pho 90 was great. Staying on the strip and got tired of eating the food there, I needed something fresh. Pho 90 is off strip, sort of near the Golden Tiki, so I knew the area. Simple place, very clean, staff was super friendly. I got a huge bowl of pho with brisket, rare steak, and tendon. It was delicious. The Vietnamese family that was there while I was thought so too. Definitely somewhere I would go again.
Good food. Staff is new and not trained yet. If you a ready to put up with it the food worth the trip. Moodle Bistro down the street is probably better choise.

I have to say this is one of the best pho place to me here in Vegas because it isn't open 24 hours like most of the pho place around here. I notice that the pho restaurant that opens 24 hours the pho isn't good. The broth taste more water down and the meat quality is bad. But this place is really good. You can really taste the beef in the soup like your supposed too and the meat inside the pho looks fresh and very tender. The bowl are huge for a cheap price. The spring rolls are also very good. You can tell they make it as it's order cause the shrimp and pork inside is always warm. So I recommend coming here if your looking for a place to eat pho.

New pho place in Vegas next to Tea station. Came in to a cute and clean place and we ordered pho dat biet, mi kho and egg rolls. Kevin was super nice and when we got our food everything was good. I've been to all the pho restaurants in Vegas and this one is def my fav and would even compare it to OC Viet restaurants but with better service. :P Would have taken pics of our food but we slurp it down so fast. Haha
Wasted my lunch break waiting on my meal, I'm not sure if the food is good because it took so long I wasn't able to actually eat it

Had Lunch at Pho 90 last week with my boss. The food and service were excellent, we were given plenty of time to decide what we wanted, servers helped recommend items we might like as we were there for the first time
first time eating pho, wasn't a good experience. staff was friendly, perhaps it wasn't my type of food

I have been here before and had a good experience. This time however, I didn't it was different people there.  The girl at rhe counter was terrible I don't know if she is family or was hired.  She was there for deceration I guess. Didnt know any thing about the menu and just stared at me waiting for me to take my order. I asked about the combination meat Pho and she didnt know what the meats that go in it were, really ok. So she runs back to gind out ok keep in mind there are only 3 meets. Ahe comes back and names 2 and says cant remeber the last what! It was only 2 sec before she asked probably wanted to get back to facebook update! So i also ordered fired rice and when they brought out my pho to go they forgot the fried rice another wait yikes and the pho was spicy, I didnt ask for spicy pho terrible experinece from 1st time to this time l. Really uou running a business guys put someone there that know what they are doing you don't need a decoration girl good luck

My new favorite Pho restaurant!!!  Great location, really cute and clean and the staff was great. The egg rolls were amazing and a large portion, I had the rare steak Pho and it was wonderful. My server was very attentive and kept my water glass full also removed our dirty plates soon after we were done. I wish it was closer to my house I live in the Northwest but it was worth the drive.

The other day I was craving pho after my last Uber pick up. So I went on yelp and noticed this place has a lot of 5 star reviews. So I went in, awesome pho tai sai and egg rolls. It was my first pho place since moving from California. Definitely will come back and try the other things on the menu. 

Kevin who works there was very prompt on serving me. Nice guy and good conversation. They open at 9am everyday and close at 2am on the weekends. 12am on week days. The only bad thing, parking here can be tough to find. It's because there are other restaurants there.

Oh one thing I forgot to mention, Kevin told me they been in business for 2 months now. Hopefully they stay in business down the road which I think they will.
Pho was AWESOME!!!! Maybe service was a little slow but overall their pho was bomb!!!

We were here Wednesday afternoon and I will go as far by saying that this is probably the best pho I've eaten in a while if not ever. The broth was rich and beefy. The noodles to meat ratio was generous. My girlfriend had the Bun Bo Hue and that also was delicious. The broth was perfect. If only we can bring the restaurant back home to Minnesota, we'd visit quite often. I cant wait to come back to Vegas!

The positive: The food is good. 

But the service and wait time was ridiculous. At 10pm our table of 3 was one of two parties in the restaurant. We ordered and proceeded to wait for over 45min for a pho and two vermicelli bowls. They got one item wrong and realized it after we had waited 40min. So we proceeded to wait for one person's food for well over an hour. Ridiculous.

The food was disgusting  nasty and big disappointment the pho has a lot of m s g the veg not fresh it old and stale and also I found hair in my food the smoothie drink not real fruit  it is powder with a lot of sugar add to it I give this place a thumb down

So this is the second time we came here and we ventured out and shared a chicken banh mi and it was amazing! The bread was perfect  

The chicken pho and the rare steak were equally delicious.

The service is good and the owner is very nice. It's nice to stop
By for
Lunch and then peruse the shopping center next door to walk it off.

This review is going to be short and sweet, unlike this dining experience. I came with my mom and friend. My mom ordered pho bo nam ve gau, which was missing gau, the ve was so thinly sliced that it wasn't crunchy, and the nam had not the slight piece of fat on it so it was beyond dry (it also tasted like it had been frozen - adding to the dryness). We also asked for a plate of pickled onions (hanh ngam dam) and they really skimped on it and only gave us a plate of 12 onion rings. My friend ordered the goi ga and the chicken was definitely frozen and microwaved to DEATH! It was the driest chicken we had ever eaten and tasted like tough cardboard. It was also all breast meat, where goi ga usually comes with chicken thighs with bone. It was inedible. And I ordered bun thit nuong, which was the best of the three dishes. The pork tasted like it was really charcoal grilled, which was really fragrant. In conclusion, as Vietnamese people coming from Orange County, California (Vietnamese central), we believe the high reviews  for this restaurant were written mostly by white people. This is a Vietnamese no-no!

I gave this restaurant another shot hoping they would be better and nothing has changed. This will be my last that I will come here again. I arrived here Friday night around between the hours of 9:30 to 9:45pm and it was not that busy only a few patrons that were inside. As soon as I walked in I was seated in a timely manner. After I was seated, it went downhill from here. After I was given a menu to look at on what to order, the sever took almost 20 to 30 mins before she came to get my order. When the server finally came over to take my order, I had ordered a Spring Roll appetizer and Combo Pho. After this order, I nearly waited half and hour till I got my food. My entree came out first before my appetizer. The pho was nothing to rave about, I have had better. The spring roll disappointed. My water was not refilled. All in total time, I was here for nearly two hours with service and server that lacked. To pay for my meal took even longer. Needless to say, I will not be coming back here anytime soon till they figure out on how to have better service and servers.

Honestly, not too shabby! This strip mall is POPPIN. So many great places to try and visit near by. The prices here are milder (more reasonable) than others I've seen around the Vegas area which is nice. Medium sized restaurant that is clean and provides good service! They have a few tv screens, one playing what looked like a Viet food network which I was definitely intrigued by and others with rnb YouTube videos. 
The pho was pretty tasty! A lil too oily for my liking but the flavor was good! Garnishes were fresh. 
Bun thit nuong with egg roll was delicious. Their thit was SOO good. You could taste actual grilled flavor. Would go back for this, alone. Their nuoc mam was decent, too. 
Spring rolls were tasty. Their pb and hoisin dipping sauce ratio was nice. Not too much of either

I would go back! 
Parking in that lot sucks at peak hours, just FYI
Pho broth was flavorful. Very clean restaurant. And staff was very nice. The bahn mi was really good. On the larger side. (Which is good ). Very attentive with service. Will bE coming back for sure

Dined in for 3 pho Dac Biet. Broth was good. Meat was also good. Service was good. They came around a lot to ask how everything was. Just remember to have a pitcher of water when you're walking a round so you can refill our waters too. 

Ordered takeout on a different night. 3 bun bo hue. It was packed very nicely. I've never added shrimp paste to my broth but it was included so I tried and it really added lots of flavor to the broth. I also added some chili oil because the broth wasn't spicy enough. But after adding those 2 things the broth tasted perfect! Noodles were cooked well. 

Only thing I didn't like was the pork hock because it tasted too gamey and had a strong porky smell, think it needed to be cleaned better and maybe cooked a little bit longer. 

Will definitely order the bun bo hue again though.

Pho 90 HANDS DOWN has the best broth in Vegas.


Also their Vietnamese sandwich is the best . The bread is toasted just right and it's not hard like other sandwiches . 

I've been meaning to write a review the first visit but I was too busy eating and in food heaven lol . They open late and it's not crowded ! 

Support my new pho place , they the best fsho!

Who the f*** gave this place 5 stars? I deleted my Yelp app after trying this place out. Food taste like s***. Yelp sucks donkey d*** lately with fake reviews. The lady took my order without writing it down. Got my order wrong 2 times. The seafood pho my wife ordered looked like s***. The Pho Tai I ordered was so f***** sweet, they told me it was full of MSG. F**** disgusting and I'm more disappointed at my fellow Yelpers for reviewing this place as a 5 star. F***** Pho Nasty MSG is what they should call this place.

Nice clean restaurant. Big portion. Very delicious.
Courteous hosts.
Definitely will be back.

I found this little joint after a couple different tries looking for a pho place. Their pho broth is delicious and their pork bahn mi sandwich is flavorful and rock. I always get the extra large with seafood inside it and i can almost finish it.

Unpretentious, delicious, and open usually pretty late. My favorite!

I come here every time when I visit Las Vegas. Their Pho is super hot and always tase great. Price and service also on point. Plus they don't smell Pho on you after you leave the restaurant. Good luck guys.

Great pho! Broth is really really good! Hu tieu
Was good do half hu tieu half egg noodles makes a huge difference ! Egg rolls were really good as well! Everyone was nice and friendly ! Nice new place! You should check it out!
This has had to best vietnamese food hands down eveeything in the menu is delish! The waitress is real nice get the one with make up! She knows what's up! The sandwiches are to die for!

Pho can't get any better than it does at this tiny place.  The service was excellent and friendly.  Pho was hot and delicious. Big portion of fresh basil and sprouts.  Very happy with everything here and we will be back!  If you are a fan of Pho find your way over here on your next visit.

The Pho is what I consider healing. Every time I feel like I'm getting sick or a cold coming on Pho 90 is there for me. I usually order two things: Rare Steak Pho and Curry Chicken w/ Rice plate. The curry chicken is a wonderful dish that is bursting with flavor. The Pho never lets me down.  Excellent choice if you want to experience the healing powers of the Pho.

Can't wait to eat here again! Came here after a Target run, and was so hungry and exhausted. 

I got the vegetable pho soup- full of tofu, broccoli, mushrooms, bok choy+ PLENTY of rice noodles! Plus they give you a plate of bean sprouts, mint, etc. to add. Definitely hit the spot.

My friend got the pad thai, which is also a great choice, plus a thai iced tea which I regret not getting. 

We came kind of late (1/2 hour to closing) which usually I try to avoid doing to restaurants, as I know they are trying to close, but they were super kind and didn't make us feel bad. 

Definitely reccomend!

Bad place ! Too greasy. It should be this way ! 
Common sense take the white fatty part out of soup before serving it!!

I can eat Pho everyday. That being said, I can cook Pho. While we are in Vegas, it was cold so we went to find Pho and I can't tell you how often I'm disappointed with other restaurants Pho but not here. 
Their Pho broth here has the least MSG taste. Let me emphasize that it's extremely rare for me to like other people Pho, so I highly recommend their Pho here. 
My 5 stars is purely for the food. Service and other things have room for improvement

I have been to Vegas so many times but last year was the first time I traveled to this place. That day, I drove by and saw Grand Opening so I decided to give it a try. The soup was good and especially the noodle was just right enough for one person. My husband and I stayed in Vegas for a week so we kept going back everyday to eat Pho and Com Suon. We love the food and the server! Very neat!! Thumbs up
Here the surface is delicious, shrimp fried rice is also very tasty, we recommend to try new stores.Vietnamese friends like to come here.

Best pho I've had in a while. The broth is soooo fragrant!  Everything else was perfectly seasoned. Outstanding!  Who needs to pay crazy prices on the strip when this place is so close and really good!  Ate here twice.

OK, I take it back. The San Gabriel Valley and Orange County are not the only places in the Southwestern US with great Vietnamese food. The combo banh mi blows away most of the SGV ones. The bread! Wow! Seafood combo pho is a 5-star item too: complex broth, super fresh calamari, and not too much salt. Oh, speaking of fresh, I was teasing our server, asking him if he had to go dig up the bean sprouts in the back yard. Freshest ones I've ever had!

So, yes, five stars.

I ordered the combo pho and pork banh mi sandwich. The pho came out in a few minutes but the sandwich took forever.

The pho broth was flavorful without being overly salty. It could use a longer simmering in beef bones or just more beef bones to have a beefier flavor. It also lacked the aroma of pho spices that I am used to. But it came out hotter than most places I have tried in Las Vegas and that is a bonus. I finished my pho before my sandwich came which was pretty bad.

The sandwich was pretry good compared to most of the places in Vegas which use the overly sweet pork in theirs. So cudos for the best pork banh mi in Vegas so far.

Service is a bit lacking. There was one young lady running the entire front during lunch and she was constantly hustling and helping custoners the whole time I was there. They need to hire another person up front and this place would get 5 stars if service improves. No fault of the person currently running everything herself. The place is just not organized.

Bottom line is if the food is good I will return. Which I will. They had some good reviews for a few of my other favorite Vietnamese dishes so I'll be checking those put soon. 

Being relatively new to Las Vegas it is always challenging having to find good Vietnamese food because its a dime a dozen in populated places. Everyone thinks they can make a good broth, which is the core of all Vietnamese soups.
First time eating here and food was delicious, great, prompt service and clean!!! Totally recommend!

I am a regular weekly diner at Pho Saigon 8. Decided to check out Pho 90 after my daughter's speech tournament. All I can say is wow.. We ordered  2 bowls of pho, eggrolls, and dac biet bahn mi sandwich. The pho broth had a more sweeter taste than saigon 8 but still very good. The noodle/meat portion size is larger than average which was great. Eggrolls were very crisp and delicious and you get 5 not 4. No veggies/herbs to make a lettuce roll though. The bahn mi sandwich was awesome with plenty of meat and the bread was still slightly warm. Overall, the portion sizes are excellent for the price and the food quality is top notch. Highly recommended. Unfortunately, finding parking might be an issue. Go during off hours.

Excellent pho!! Excellent service!! Friendly service. Super clean. If you don't think this broth is one of the best you ever had I would be very surprised. 
Oh I don't want to forget about the fresh brewed at your table Vietnamese press coffee. Most places have it pre-made in the back not here everything was super fresh and high quality from the meat, sprouts and even the condiments in the table.

We had to go back for a late dinner, two nights after our first visit. Again another great dining experience. Our waiter Eric was knowledgeable and patient with our large party of 6. It was like we were guests at his own home.
Great stuff! It was my first time ordering from them. I ordered online through Yelp. I got the seafood pho and steak pho. Food was delivered promptly and very fresh, too.

The pho is on greasy side but that's when you know it's not that fake powder stuff and made from actual beef bones!

The waitress also needs an attitude check. No hi or anything. I ordered a coconut and she somehow forgot it. She also gave us or wrong phos without asking. 

I got their pho tai with tripe and it's a decent sized bowl for $8.50! I loved their broth. It reminded me of Vietnam again. My only complaint is that the bowl can have a lot more tripe since it was almost non existent! 

The pho is good but not a place I would make my way down to Chinatown for.
This is officially my favorite Pho restaurant ever. Love the customer service and their food is amazing. Great atmosphere overall. If I could give it more than 5 stars, I really really would.

Ordered the rare beef and tendon pho with egg noodle, as well as spring rolls. Turns out they were out of spring rolls, so just stuck with the pho. Food came out quick...but incorrect. No egg noodles, they gave me regular rice. Since I hate sending food back, I just ate it. Noodles were borderline mushy, bean sprouts old and broth a little oily. My favorite part of pho is the broth, and this was not very flavorful.  There was not much color to it, which explains the lack of flavor. Also, they really skimp on meat. I think I counted maybe three small pieces of tendon and same with the steak. Staff super friendly, but I've had better pho at Kim long or Saigon 8.

Food was good but a few mishaps. We started with the eggrolls which came out hot and crispy. I wanted the chicken pho - was told they ran out of chicken? Hmm at 1130am? So I opted for the porkchop rice plate. Others ordered pho bowls and a shrimp stir fry rice plate.

One plate came out at a time roughly 3-5 mins in between instead of all together. One pho bowl, another pho bowl then my rice plate. About 15 mins after the first dish came out, our waitress informed my friend that the only veggies they have is bok Choy for the stir fry, is that ok? She said no and was told to find another option. She chose shrimp pho - she was told, sorry we don't have chicken broth and that's what's used for the shrimp pho. Had to wait some more....My porkchop was seasoned nicely and was very tasty. The pho broth was delicious and piping hot, the way it should be. 

All in all, the food is really good but the fact they weren't prepared for all customer requests at lunchtime was a turn off - took a star off for that. Other than that, if you want regular beef pho - come check this out. Tip : located in Chinatown, get a 24 hour bus pass and take the 203 bus to get here if you're on the strip.

Undeserving of the current 4+ star rating. Food isn't horrible but isn't anything special. Service was slow and inattentive for a near empty restaurant. Be sure to check your pho order because you may be missing some meats (ex. No tendon)

We always want to try this place. Today is a perfect day. Me and my husband love Vietnamese coffee. You can tell them how sweet you like. I got some kind of noodle with tomato soup. I can't remember what it's called. It's really good. My husband and my daughter got grilled pork sandwiches. Both of them are picky eaters when it comes to Asian food. They love the sandwiches. I found new Vietnamese restaurant that they both like. 

Restaurant is really clean. Our servers are super nice. They recommend us what should we order. 

The restaurant is in China town area. Easy to get there from the strip. If you are in town and want to try good Vietnamese food , I really recommend this place.  Next time I will post some pictures.  I was so hungry and forgot to take pictures.

What a wonderful time. When we first entered we noticed the tasteful and modern decor. We were immediately greeted in a very friendly manner. The service started on a great note and was excellent throughout. My wife and I split a bowl of pho and a recommended pork chop with egg , rice and vegetables. Also egg rolls. Compared to other Vietnamese restaurants the ingredients were very fresh and carefully chosen. We are hooked will be regulars.

This place is a great new little spot (in the same building as Ichiza and Tea Station). 
The menu is pretty big with a variety of noodle soup and rice dishes. The atmosphere is warm and inviting and the service is really great! The pho comes in 3 sizes: small, large and Xtra large! And it's really not expensive at all! The broth had lots of flavor, they didn't skimp on the noodles and they are very accommodating! No vegetarian options so I hope they add some tofu dishes in the future. This place is also open late! So do yourself a favor and check it out! I'm definitely coming back!

Very impressed with Pho 90. This was our first time here and I gotta say, everything we ordered was absolutely delicious. After a sub-par experience at another Pho place in Vegas, we were wary about trying another one. But boy, did this place show up. 

Pho with rare steak, tendon, beef balls: very flavorful broth that stays hot until the end, just the way I like it. Lots of meat, and great chili oil. 5/5

Pork & Shrimp Spring Rolls: fresh veggies, a good amount of meat, with sprigs of mint. I found the mint to be a little overwhelming, but that's just my taste. 4/5

Charbroiled Pork Banh Mi: for me, this was the highlight of the meal. The bread is what makes the banh mi and they nailed it. Every bite was so flavorful and buttery. A must try! 5/5

Guava Smoothie: all of their smoothies are made with fresh fruit and this one was bomb. Very refreshing. 4/5

All in all, Pho 90 was outstanding. It's a small mom n pop shop and I'm almost certain there's a Vietnamese mama or grandma in the back just cooking up a beautiful storm for their customers. Now for them to open one up in California? A girl could dream!

Very decent pho located in Chinatown.  I've been to several of pho joints in Chinatown and this one actually taste good.  It's sad, but true, pho in Vegas, quality can't compared to the ones in So Cal, but pho 90 somehow come close.  

Been here twice, had their pho special, egg rolls, banh mi and bun.  All tasted ok.  Service can be a little slow because there is only one server on the floor.
Friendly service, fire food, open till 12 what else ya need? Coming out of the LA this place is a good send for those post night drunchies. Totally worth it.

So we are trying out new places in the area and are on this Pho kick... 4.5 stars isn't a bad "let's try it" place... maybe I should have read more reviews and not been as hungry as I was. 

When we entered (1hr before closing) we weren't greeted and walked to the back to find the hostess, who was nice enough, but was in training and knew absolutely nothing. Literally everything we asked about she had no clue what was in it. 

When the hurried owner/server was told we had questions, he answered them well enough but actually discouraged certain food as though it were nasty (thanks!) HOWEVER, I don't know why they just didn't say, "All we have left is Pho" because everything we tried to ordered wasn't available or the machine to cook wasn't working -- personally I think they were already cleaned and didn't want to bother, understandable but again, just serve Pho,  after a certain time. (At least I think he was the owner, as he was training the hostess/new waitress)

The pho broth is definitely oilier than I had hoped, it has a good taste but all the oil ruins it. We got the P13 - Rare Steak & noodles... the meat wasn't excellent but not horrible, definitely needed extra Hoisin Sauce! But again, we've been eating Pho for awhile now -- the amount of oil in the broth made me a little nauseous, I didn't eat as much as I had hoped...

& the place is called Pho90, but it should be called Pho9

Very little chance we will give this place another shot since there are DOZENS of Pho restaurants even within walking distance (we almost went to the one across the street on accident, kind of wish we would have made the mistake!)

I was here when they were just open, but I didn't leave a review back then. I visit again for dinner, so I thought post an review would be good since the waitress was so nice to us.

Environment: it's a pretty causal place for dine out, the waitress was very friendly. She answered my question patiently and gave me good advices.

Appetizer:
Chicken salad: the waitress recommended chicken salad for me, I ordered it and I love it. They seasoned it well and the chicken tasted tender. It's little sweet!

Pho:
Beef stew pho: the soup was life. I literally drink all of it. The beef stew was the part I'm not happy about, it tasted so chewy and rubbery, and it so dry and it stuck between my teeth. 

Overall: I would come back again for chicken salad. If they could make their beef stew better, I would order again, since the soup was amazing.
I ordered the seafood pho and it was the best seafood pho I had in a restaurant.  The food came fast.  And the waitress was prompt.  I'd come back when in Las Vegas.

Very flavorful broth with strong herbal kick. I've had pho in multiple countries and many states and this place has one of my favorite broths.

Another relatively unique item here is their taro shake, made with real taro. Every other pho place I've been to uses just taro powder.

Service is great as well, although you're prly not going to a pho joint for service. And, the late night hours top it off!

Wowww the pho here is so good. I'd say it's better than east coast pho in general. Broth is on point, plenty of meat and good portions. Thai iced tea was good as well as the spring rolls. What a find! Well deserving of 5 stars.

What separates this place from all the other Pho places in town is how personable their customer service is. 

Last night, after 4 hours of driving home from SoCal, my friends and I decided to check out this new place because another place we had originally gone to was packed. To my surprise, this place turned out to be amazing! 

When it comes to their Pho, I didn't find it to be all that exciting. But who cares? I'm not the one who ordered it. As far as I can tell, my bf inhaled it so it must be good. I'm just not a Pho person.

Their B1 Vermicelli hit the spot! In most places, their noodle to veggie ration seems a little off. This place gave me an even ratio or a little more noodles! I'm thankful for that since I'm ordering a noodle dish, not a veggie dish! Their sauce is a little different, tastier with a kick of spicy. Though I'm not a fan of spicy, I definitely didn't mind it. 

The server, Eric, was really comfortable around us. He didn't act like a robot server which I kind of understand if you do the same thing over and over again. I liked that he was simple about how he checked on us. Not over excessive. Just peaks over and makes eye contact in case we needed something with an occasional "that's the sound of good eating. Anything else I can get for you at the moment?" question. 

What I like the most about this place is how each and every table has plugs. It's almost like an invitation for you to work here while you eat. I'm not sure if that's what they were going for or if people even do that at Pho places but I like that they give me the option. 

Recommended!

The owner and customer service was AMAZING! She gave us a desert on the house because it's rarely made and she saw that me and my boyfriend were loving the food. We order pho (the broth was so good) the spring roll was amazing and the eggrolls. Tai tea is definitely a must and I would love to come again. I loved it

Find my new spot to grab a beef banh mi. 

Normally I'll go to Vietnamese places for pho, but ever since I had a brisket banh mi back in Anaheim I've been looking for one here in Vegas! I saw this place carried a beef version, which is great because normally most places only have pork variety. And I don't eat pork (aside from spam musubi and BBQ pulled pork sandwiches, sorry, can't resist). 

Back to the restaurant - it's not too big, they have booths along the sides and a couple of tables in the middle. There was only one guy serving every table so service was slow. I'd rate it a 3/5. 

For the banh mi I'd give the bread alone 5/5! Soft on the inside and has a nice crunch once you bite into it. Inside the sandwich you'll find a few shreds of carrot and pickled radish, some cucumbers, beef, and cilantro. The sandwich as a whole was not bad, once I added some fish sauce and sriracha it was way better. However one thing I don't prefer is that they use lard instead of mayo to spread on the bread, and maybe this is normal but I'm just not a fan of the fatty mouthfeel so I ate around that part. Maybe I'll try to order it without that spread next time. Overall this place will be my go to whenever I crave banh mi.

Great waiter! Attentive and considerate.  Very on top of it!
We got the large Pho 90 bowl, huge bowl, plenty even for two very hungry people. Probably could feed 3.
Spring rolls felt very fresh and clean.
The place is modern and quaint, easy accessible bathrooms. 7 regular sized tables and two large table for bigger parties.

Let me start off by saying this place has pretty good food. Had several different broths and a sandwich, pho was pretty great, sandwich was good but we have tasted better.
Unfortunately this place gave us the impression that they cannot handle a big load of customers, which is sad because this place is rather small. Getting in, we inquired about the smoothies. They told us right off the bat that we could order it but would take them a really really long time to get it to us because they were backed up. We had to ask for limes 3 times in a span of 15 min. Water refills were nonexistent during our stay. The sandwich came out about 15 to 20 min after we got our Pho. All of this and not even a full house, about 2-3 tables empty. 

Though the food was pretty good, the experience was not at all ideal. I'd advise against this place unless they are not busy.

Horrible language barrier here. Ordered P4 and it came with Tripe (ewwwwww!!) called the server over and he said the English menu doesn't specify it but supposedly the Viet version does????? How the hell does that make sense?!? He couldn't even explain to me because his English was terrible. I have a shrimp allergy and from that point didn't want to eat any of the other dishes we ordered because how the hell do i know if there's shrimp
In it or not because that menu is unreliable from that point. Egg rolls are whackkkkkk! Seems like super generic frozen brand...Don't eat here. Only came here since they opened early. Searching Yelp now for another pho house because I'm starving!!!

Just opened 2 weeks ago and already killing the pho game! 

Staff is super friendly, fast and customer focused. I didn't catch his name but one of the owners approached us and asked for our input on the food and how they could improve. I appreciate that he took the time to have a genuine conversation like we were already regulars. 

I ordered Pho Tai (P13) and my boyfriend had a Combination Pho (P1) and we really enjoyed the broth. It did not taste watered down. We were super hungry and ordered a large but I could have been good with a small. They offer small, large, and x-large bowl size. 

The same kind gentleman also gave us egg rolls on the house bc he overheard my boyfriend say he was hungry and they didn't have the potstickers he wanted at the time. 

Overall I had a memorable time here and I will be back not only for the service but the yummy, affordable food.

I decided to skip my regular pho spots after a plethora of 5-star Yelp reviews from this new business caught my attention.   Dining solo today, I ordered their fresh spring rolls as an appetizer and the P1) Pho dac biet as my main.  I tried to order cooked dishes to-go to bring home to my wife but apparently their stoves weren't working.  Pretty much half the menu was not an option today.  Though they apologized, this was a disappointing way to start a dining experience.

The spring rolls came first and I was impressed.   The portion size was large and their take on a peanut dipping sauce was fantastic.  The ingredients seemed fresh enough and I would definitely order these again on a follow-up visit.

Their pho was equally great.  The clear broth had a nice clean taste and the bowl was stacked to the brim with various cuts of meat.  If you're new to pho, the pho dac biet comes with well-done and rare flank steak, beef balls, tripe, tendon along with a hefty portion of thin rice noodles.   Accompanying the bowl is a side dish filled with bean sprouts, peppers, basil leaves, and limes.  First try the savory broth, then add to your heart and stomach's desire.

Overall a nice option for those late night cravings for pho.   I'll be returning to try their non-soup options in the future and hopefully add the 5th star to this review.
If there are rivers in heaven, they must be flowing with the same broth served here. I could drown in the stuff and die happy.

This place is very clean and nice. Service is ok not the best I didn't know you seat yourself until the man at the register spoke up. Pho was delicious broth is very good has great flavor and they aren't stingy with the brisket/flank. If you know what I mean lol -- gave 3 stars only because I ordered their Viet ice coffee and It literally was a cup full of ice. Small cup maybe 12oz but felt like 4oz was actually coffee not worth $4-5 . Got maybe 3 sips--as for pho it's delicious but Try for yourself.

Food was .... meh alright. They didn't offer any vegetables with Pho though the spring rolls were great ( can't really screw up on that). Refill of water never offered and the entrées came out one at a time ~15 minutes apart from each other. Imo the banh mi cost too much compared to others that I have had elsewhere. I'm sticking to Viet Noodle though it's always nice to try other places.

To start, this place has good food. The pho isn't like the best, but it's not the worst. It's definitely better than average. The service is always good, but I mean, it's not too hard to mess up. Don't expect anything fancy, their decor could definitely use more work, but again, I don't necessarily go there for the environment, I go for the food. If you're in the area, and want decent food, definitely give this place a try. You won't be disappointed, you'll just be full lol

First time trying out Pho and it was great! Our server constantly came to check up on us and ensure everything was okay! Although, the food took longer than expected to arrive it was definitely worth it. Next time I'm in Vegas and in the mood for some Vietnamese food, I'll be back.

First of all, they play great music i.e. Outkast - Ms. Jackson, AND PLAY THE MUSIC VIDEOS 

Second, the food and service is amazing. Eric (or is it Erik) is super friendly, made sure that we were taken care of from start to end, and even topped off my small togo sauce container with extra sauce so I would have enough when eating my leftover spring roll!!! Like tyvm man!

Third, idk I felt like I needed to write a "third".

Just go. You won't be disappointed yelpers~~~
Just a tip, the place looks very gloomy and the pho is less flavorful compared to other pho places.

I went for the first time and wow! This place blows Viet Noodle bar and Pho Kim Long out of the water. The Broth had tons of flavor the meat was outstanding. I can't wait to come back and try some more menu items.
Food is delicious. Some of the best Vietnamese I've had. Pho and beef sandwich is the must try combo.
I used to settle for a different pho restaurant every time I come to visit Las Vegas.  But I searched yelp and found this establishment and WOW broth is so good.  Now my new go to!
We came in like 3 days ago, the foods were ok but the service was good. They are really nice
Good was perfect,the service was not. They closed an hour earlier than they were supposed to,so they were rushing out customers to close.
This is great Vietnamese!  The Pho is so delicious and flavorful that you don't need to add anything!
Their banh mi is amazing and their taro boba is delicious.  Their bun bo hue is flavorful but they use the thin bee slices used for pho in it so that's kind of weird.

Came here because Pho Kim Long was super busy. Needless to say, this place is really freaking good. Food was great, service was great, and everything was clean. Prices are amazing! I ordered the beef ball pho which was about $8.25 (?)The broth was amazing and the soup was super hot. It was so good that I didn't need to suffocate the soup with bell sprouts, lemon, Sriracha, or hoisin sauce!! Call me a monster, but I ate the soup plain. I never do that, lol. It was just that good! 
The only downside is that they did not have any iced black coffee or monster and my boyfriend was looking forward to the iced coffee  :-( 
I will be coming back in the future to order more pho. Hopefully, they have coffee then! :-)

One person on the floor with full tables, skips taking order and forgets to bring us water. We had to waive her down to get her attention, also it's been 30min since I've been sitting here and our food isn't here yet. The waitress is a bit nutty, yea NUTTY, she forgot the tables and order numbers. I don't know it's horrible service and I have yet to taste the food.

Absolutely outstanding this by far is the best Pho~ I have had in years....The staff was very attentive and courteous. Portions are huge for the price, most Pho~ combinations are $8.50  When in Vegas I highly recommend Pho90

The worst possible place for Pho. Had no choice but to stay because our group was hangry and did not want to look for another place to eat. Let me start by saying, no AC. Bad service . The girl did not know how to take our order other than by the number on the menu .. you could not stray off course. 20 mins later to get our lukewarm pho out and to have one  bowl missing .. then continues to insist that her order was brought out, evidently she no Bowl in front of her . The pho was mediocre with hard rock pieces of meat . Then when we asked about our ice tea, btw it came out 10 mins after our pho, the server yelled at us and said she was still making it . Then came our egg roll appetizer at the end of the meal.  No apologies for the delays or bad customer service . No excuses, it wasn't even packed !

This review has nothing to do with the food. I was not given a chance to try it. We Ubered out to Chinatown in hopes of late night pho, but were turned away at the door over an hour before the posted closing time. Don't advertise hours if you're not going to stick to them.
Was super yummy. Service was best I have had for a pho restaurant in Vegas!! Food was quality and everything was large portions. Prices were good too.

The food was good and affordable for the first time being their also great customer service they be seeing me soon too thanks also they play good music it's poppin' to if you're not picky about pho try it out I like it

This Pho restaurant is the best in town! Not only is the food good, but our servers Marlix & Monica gave a warm welcome to my girlfriend and I. I was visiting from California and Japan. They talked with us and made sure that everything was going well during our visit. Thanks girls!

I recommend the rare steak & brisket Pho, it's pretty good

The pho is very good, broth is delicious and make from real bone and meat. They just open recently i guess since the servers kind of slow and confuse. I am totally fine w the service 
Highly recommend this place
Great little spot. Pho soup was on point. Staff was fast and attentive. And it was busy. I'll come back

Ordered over the phone and it was ready within 15 minutes.  Under $11 for each meal and super tasty.  I had the bbq pork vermicelli.  Vermicelli was a little sticky being takeout but soaked up the spicy chili oil to perfection.  Not as spicy as I'd hoped, but enough chili oil and sriracha can give anything the necessary heat.  Bbq pork was actually extremely well cooked and tasty, similar to a hot pot or Korean bbq type of meat.  Carrots and bean sprouts galore in the dish rounded out the meal.  Really big portion and quality; nothing more I can ask for.  Literally no one there at 6:30pm on a weekday so hopefully they can keep it going as they've had over the year as this is some of the best Vietnamese in the city.  Parking can be tricky if you go during prime times at that plaza, so use Grubhub to remove the hassle.
Pho 90 is my new cold weather favorite place to go. The Pho, spring rolls and service are all great. I come here at least twice a week.

This place is legit, probably my favorite pho restaurant so far in Vegas, the pho broth reminds me alot of the broth  in LA 626 area, and gave a good amount of meat in the Pho dac biet, also had a little bit of the Bun Thiet Nuong , the pork was marinated and grilled to perfection nice smokey char taste. Will definitely come back again and try other items...

Very delicious food and great customer service. The waiters were very friendly. P3 was the soup I got and I wasn't disappointed. Young coconut juice was perfect the way it was. Spring rolls were on point and so were the fried egg rolls.

Wanted to give this place a try after Sunday mass. We were the second group that came in. The first were already done eating. We didn't get to order until the group AFTER us ordered. My dad tried ordering a stirfry noodle dish, but the waiter said that we can't order stirfry dishes until after 11... And it was already 10:58 when we ordered. Umm??? OK. Got our food and it wasn't the greatest but it also wasn't bad. VERY GREASY. I'll admit, I like greasy but this was a lot. I scooped out a couple spoonful of oil. We decided to order 1 banh mi sandwich to-go. My mom went up to go pay since they're not very attentive, but they told her to sit down and pay when the sandwich was done. We waited another 10-15 minutes just for ONE sandwich. We specifically asked for "no chili and no mayo". But guess what?! We got both! Our waiter did not seem too customer service friendly. Never. Again.

Service was super slow. The server saw us but acted like he didn't acknowledge us. I had to go get the menu by myself after sitting there for 10 mins. Took 30 mins for my food to be arrived. It was ok. Don't think I'll come back.
Great food. Pho is a lot better than most places in Vegas possibly the best here. Highly recommended to try and enjoy great food
Pho is the best I've had in Vegas, taste is authentic. Place is a bit small. Service was quick and staff are friendly.

All i can say is WOW! The morning after a night of going hard on the strip I knew i needed pho....good pho glad I had been recommended Pho 90 this place has some of the best broth i have ever had PERIOD, and the service is A++. I couldn't finish the large bowl, which is the size i always order. Also the grilled pork spring rolls where excellent

Looking for a quick place to eat Pho. Mistake in coming here. The girl who took our order was unpleasant. And after she took our order she left, and so the new girl didn't know anything about our table. Highly frustrating! But Marlix, the waitress who took over, was extremely kind, very friendly.

My fellow yelpers didn't let me down with this recommendation.

I have'nt had pho for a while. This place is in Chinatown and the small parking lot is always packed on the weekends, but I swooped by pretty early today and found a spot.  

Everything looked great on the menu and the noodle dishes also comes in "XL size."

For takeout, I ordered-
P11: Tai Gan - rare steak, tendon, and rice noodle. 

B4: Bbq Pork with Vermicelli and

Golden Egg rolls which was delightfully crispy.

Broth is tasty and just the perfect amount of star anise and seasoning , with generous chunks of bbq pork, tendons, and sides.  The rare slices of beef flank were packed separately on the side.  I like to throw those in the broth once it comes out but luckily they weren't well done. The Bbq pork was well seasoned.

Quality and quantity.  Best of both worlds.  Overall a statisfying bowl of pho.  Next time it will be Banh Mi sandwiches and Smoothies.
Hands down to this place. Best pho place I've ever been to. Customer service was excellent and very clean. Would definitely recommend to anyone in town.

OMG amazing food! A few minutes drive off the strip but so worth it.  

I tried B1 (vermicelli noodles with BBQ pork and egg rolls). We were told this would take 10 mins to be prepared as the pork is made fresh to order. And it was worth the wait - the BBQ pork was delicious. I ordered an extra portion on the side. Along with an extra portion of the egg spring rolls. 

The pork banh mi was gorgeous. Fresh ingredients and crunchy baguette. 

The pho was exceptional too. And to top it all off, the service was fantastic.

I'll be going back soon for more!

This is my favorite pho restaurant in Vegas!!! Ordered rare pho and green tea. Very flavorful and many different fresh condiments for different taste. Thank you Kevin for your professionalism and thoughtfulness to make this place my new home... we will be regulars

I am telling you this is the best pho place in town.  I been to many different pho restaurants, including Pho Kim Long, the only legit part about that restaurant is its name, because the wait time there is "Pho Kim Long".

Pho 90 is always my go to place.  Friendly service, cheap price, great taste and good quantity.  I highly recommend others to try this place.

P.S: They are open till 2 am now.
Some of the best spring rolls and vermicelli I've ever had. My girlfriend loves their Pho.

I saw this new restaurant with five star review and was excited to give it a try I really like Vietnamese food. I ordered the clear noodles with pork and seafood. The soup was sweet, Tasted like it was made with lots of sugar and MSG. They priced it at $11.99 which is expensive  for what you get Especially when they use imitation crab meat. Sorry but I cannot recommend this place.

I love this place. The hospitality is so unreal. I go here at least once or twice a month. Its very clean and you feel welcome when you come in. The food are really good and the portions are fair for the price. The owner/server is very nice as well. Always has a smile on him and he take care of you. I highly recommend this place. Try going to here if you are craving for some pho. (:

Excellent food! Cordial service. 
I took a friend there who had never had Vietnamese and he fell in the love with the combination chow mein.

Probably the worst service I've had in a long time. No greet when first walked in. Server just gave us our menus and never came back. Took another tables order that came in after us. We got up and left. This place needs to hire more servers.

Pho 90 has the best beef Pho I've eaten, period.  Kevin was very friendly and helpful explaining the menu.  Our food arrived quickly, fresh and hot!  If you're in Vegas and looking for great Pho, Pho 90 is the place.

Food was GREAT! Service was excellent! My sever Kevin was very considerate to my sea food and peanut allergy and even changed the music for my liking! Definitely recommend this place!! Alcohol coming soon for this fantastic place

Pros: Large portion size at an affordable price. 

Cons: N/A

Small unassuming place in a strip mall.  Parking lot available.  Greeted and seated quickly.  Ordered 2 bun dishes; one with pork with egg roll and grilled chicken bun.  Service was rather slow.  When the dishes came out 20 min later, the server apologized for the slow service saying that they had to grill the chicken.  The dishes were large and both were tasty and fresh.  So here's their score.  Food-4; quantity-5; service-3.  Obviously only one cook.  There are plenty other pho places that serve food much more quickly though and just as good.  Prices are reasonable.

Great tasting broth and egg rolls were super crunchy n had the perfect flavor. Service is lacking (as per usual at pho restaurants) but taste and price makes up for it. Would definitely go there again.

Literally the best and most delicious tasting pho in all of Vegas! I have tried most of the pho places and nothing comes close to the exceptional flavor and taste of Pho 90's heavenly broth. Now that the weather is bone chilling cold, there is nothing better then warming up your soul with an epic bowl of Pho. I love that this place is consistent and the service is friendly. I have never been disappointed here and cannot recommend it enough!!
This is the place to go for PHO!!! Very good pho place!!! Highly recommended!!! Open late, awesome service, bomb pho!

I placed an order on post mates, and when the food arrived it was awful, it wasn't prepared the way I've asked. I ordered the seafood wonton soup and they barely put any veggies and shrimp in the soup. Food was also cold. The food can use a lot of improvement for sure !!
Terrific tasting pho, the way it should taste. You'll be very pleased. Dare I say, maybe the best in all of Vegas.

This is my new pho spot in Vegas. Received great service every time I'm there. The pho, spring rolls and egg rolls are delicious here. Plus, it's affordable too. The old spot I used to go to in town just kept raising their prices. It annoyed me especially since the service and quality of the food kept going down! 

So I went on the hunt to find a great tasting Vietnamese spot that was reasonably priced too. Stumbled upon Pho 90 with a few friends. We all enjoyed it! Service was good. Restaurant seemed clean. Food came out quickly and HOT too. 

I'm a fan and will come back here again soon. 

Happy Dining, 

JT

Food isn't as bad but the service is really really bad. The guy had an attitude. He was pressuring us to order the combination pho. It was not just recommendation. Some of my friends wanted to eat rice and he kept repeating that it takes a long time to cook rice so we should all order combination pho. 
I ended up ordering pho but I wanted tai bo gau and his face frowned because I didn't order the combination one. Food came out late and missed some orders. 

The lady was nice though. It's just that guy that made us lose our appetite.

We went here around 10am on a Saturday morning and got sat immediately for a table of 4 ppl.  Pho, com thit nuong, & banh thit nuong all were very good.  The only thing about this place was a little long to get the food.  Small place and nothing special.

Craving pho after a night out. Decided to try somewhere new. The side of th restaurant is good not too small like other places in china town.

The service and staff are very friendly and nice. There is a lot of selection on the menu. What I love most about the restaurant is it's very clean!

I am picky picky on how I like my pho. The pho broth is tasty and flavorful. I hate when places pho taste like water.

Most def try this place out

4th straight week I e been here and I won't go anywhere else. This place is clean, service is attentive, menu is huge, and the food is very good. The prices are ultra competitive and, unlike other pho places, they have music playing. They noticed me now that I've come in a few times and they treat me like a VIP. Best pho in town!!!
I am not sure how new this place is but I am glad we tried it! Plenty of broth, meat is good unlike another popular place and 20% off a section of the menu.
Their chicken pho and their spring rolls are so good. Extra points for being across the street from my job!
Good people but their Pho has weird taste. We ordered 3 different soups but all of them have the same weird taste. We had to add hoisin and sriracha to cover up the taste

This place was great! Friendly staff, good vibe, and flavorful food at a great price to top it off! My friend and I were looking for a quick bite to eat after a night out and we found this little gem. I highly recommend!

It was a horrible experience the first time we came here some time this year during late lunch. The male server didn't care about customers and eating; he even talks to us while chewing his food when he served us. We had to wait about 30mins to get our food when there was only 1 other table:( the server kept disappearing into the kitchen all the time.

Aside from this, we come back again starting this month. The service is slow and not that great but the young female server is trying her best every time we come in. She's a sweet girl and has personality. 

The food is great. Not many options to choose from as Pho Kim Long but this place food tastes better than PKL. PKL is always packed and need to wait long and service is very bad all the time and I've been going there since 2005 mostly because they open late. but now I have a new favorite Vietnmese spot!

My boyfriend and I are so in love with the food that we went to dine 4 days in last week. The food is worth the price and the girl server name is Marlex I believe? We can tell she doesn't have much experience but she's trying her best and keeping that smile on her face all the time:) 

btw, they have the best Vietnamese Sandwiches.

Finally, a Pho place with a real X-Large bowl.  My coworker told me about this place and I thought I give it a try.  I ordered #90 X-Large, basically a combo + seafood.  I normally don't get seafood in my pho but I thought I give it a shot and I'm glad I did.  Did I mention they're having 20% off their pho during grand opening?  Will definitely be coming back.

Came in with a group of 8 at 8pm on Thurs 12/28. The young female waitress/cashier was very nice and took our order..the rest was downhill from there. Soups came out FIRST in different groups with several minutes between. Had to ask for our bean sprouts, napkins and waters. Our egg rolls came out LAST. We didnt get our 2 coffees and lemonade. A word of advice, acknowledge your guests as they walk through the door. Every guest that walked in as we were eating had a puzzled look on their faces whether to take a seat or not. To rate the food..the pho was good. The eggrolls were stale and chewy like they just defrosted them.

Loving this new spot! I'm a picky eater and even more picky with Bun Bo Hue. In all of Vegas, they always try to cut out the pig's blood because typical American wouldn't like it. And the spice level is just right. If you need more, you can ask for the secret spices straight from the kitchen! This place is definitely authentic. They are continuously trying to make new food items and make this place not just a  "there you go another Vietnamese restaurant." I feel that they're trying to make food that are personal to them, yet making a lasting impressions on others. 

I'm really gonna cross my fingers,
PLEASE  PLEASE, Pho 90, consider including Ga Chien (fried chicken) in your new menu. Thanks!

Ate here twice when we craved some late night pho. Great price, nice atmosphere, good service, and delicious pho. 
Bathroom was clean as well!

The night I was here, they played so much Mariah Carey & 90s RnB and that's honestly enough to make me come back. 

But for real, the pho here was pretty good and the customer service was excellent. Steven and I came here around 10:30ish PM PST and we were greeted by Eric, who said to sit wherever we'd like. Eric came by and brought us waters and took the time to explain the menu. Steven and I have had pho before, but it was nice having someone suggest different types of noodles (rice noodle vs vermicelli noodles) for our pho. I ordered the P9 and Steven ordered the P11. 

Our pho came out fairly fast I'd say and Eric brought us chopsticks and spoons. I really loved the spoons because they had a lip that would hang from the bowl so the spoon didn't fall into your pho. Dinner wise, I wished there was more meat. I've been to other places that have had a solid meat/noodle/pho ratio, but this place lacked that, at least last night. I'm willing to try this place again though and see if it was just an off night for the ratio.

Came in for pho around midnight. Service was excellent! Hands down the best service we've received at a local restaurant. The server was kind, joyous, and attentive. Brought us hot tea and waters upon arrival. We started off with potstickers and egg rolls. Both came accompanied with nicely made sauces. Needless to say, both of our apps were perfectly delicious! Main course was pho. We ordered p12 (rare steak and tripe) which was large enough for two. Ohhhh myyyy goood!!!! BEST pho in town!! It has such delicious, fresh flavors! We fell in love and totally pigged out! Lolol 

In all, I certainly recommend this gem!!! We look forward to our next visit which has to be very soon! 

Xoxo

I been here a few times and it has been pretty good. However, it must have been an off day or the newness is wearing off.  The pho was a little oilier than before and the veggies looked old.  The hoisin and Sriracha is either watered down or just old.  
I hope this was an off day, but who know.  

I plan on coming back again and hopefully it gets back to how it was when it first opened.
This has probably the best Pho Ga I've ever had. They are served in tremendous bowls so bring your appetite. Also don't pass up the matcha slushy, it's delicious and not overly sweet.

Pho is good...but not recommended Bun Bo Hue!
Hopefully they do better Bun Bo Hue when my next visit back to Las Vegas.

I agreed to this place because because of the yelp reviews but I regret it so much, they took forever to place our order when there was only TWO tables here. Took about 40 mins to even get our food, I even overheard them say that they forgot about our food. Let me again remind y'all that there was only TWO TABLES, including mine. The pho was salty. Don't believe the yelp reviews, go somewhere else.
Please refrain from adding any additional flavors as the broth tends to have an A1 flavor rating. Top 5 pho dine ins with superb service & pricing. Kevin with excellent service.

The food here is fantastic! Had the Bun Ga - it was great. The kids had Phó Ga and Chicken Lo Mein. It was a hit! We'll be back.  Oh - and unlike the other places near by - the service was exceptional.
Pho and banh mi. Delicious. One of those places you could eat everyday. Perfect lunch. Clean. Service was great and fast.
Super slow service. What, no bahn mi????  Wanted a quick light lunch. Ended up spending over a hour waiting for food. Food was meh. Don't understand the reviews.
Over priced $$$ Tasty soup (Pho), friendly and helpful staff. Two (2) bowls of Pho and one (1) Iced Tea Bill came to $30.00 plus the tip...
The banh mi sandwiches were so good! I thought the pho was mediocre for it seeming to be so popular. I followed my yelp instinct to check it out but I wasn't too impressed. But good none the less

Loved this place! I rarely write reviews unless they're 5 stars. The pho was hot (temperature wise) and the noodles were soft. Most of the time the noodles are a little chewy at pho places but this place was just the right texture! The bean sprouts were fresh and they gave each person their individual plate. I wish I could come back again when I visit Vegas!

Well. This wasn't fun. 
We ordered a Thai tea, spring rolls, pho and a combination bahn mi

The Thai tea is phenomenal,  I almost finished it before we got our appetizers. 

It was very dead when we came in. It was us and one other lady who already had her food. So after we had been there 10 minutes and our server came up to tell me they were all out of combination bahn mi, I was a little confused. But it's a bahn mi. They don't take long to make, so I ordered the BBQ pork bahn mi. 

At this point we got the spring rolls. Very fresh and not over cooked. Which was great. We are still wondering why it took 10 minutes to tell us about them being sold out of an item. 

5 minutes after we finished our spring rolls my bf gets his pho. And I wait. And wait. And wait. When my bf is just about done with his pho, she comes back and asks me if I want my bahn mi spicy or not spicy.... okay.... once again... couldn't this have been asked when I ordered my food? 

And finally... 5 minutes later. My bf is done with his pho and I get my bahn mi! Yay!.... but not really. Because as soon as I am about to take a bite of it. I find a hair inside my sandwich. 

Let's make this clear. If I had the bahn mi earlier and it had a hair. I wouldn't have made a big deal about it. But I had been sitting there for 20 minutes without an apology, and my bf is done eating. And I get a sandwich that will probably take another 20 minutes, and her response it to remake it.... but would I like another Thai tea? Or something else that's faster? 

I just wanted to get out of there. I was starving and didn't want to wait any longer for food, so we left. And I got tacos across the street

On a plus side... My bf said he loved the pho and that the pho in my side of town is better than his. 

I really want to give this place a second try. It's only 2 blocks from my house, and the reviews make it seem like this place is good. But I really don't think I will because of how this entire situation was handled, and everything that happened. Sorry Pho 90...

I do blame myself a bit for what happened as I didn't pay much to the reviews in the last month which has shown that this place has REALLY gone downhill. Even if a place has more than 4 stars. Check the reviews

I love this place! I'm from California and this pho broth is superb! Friendly services and served very hot! Had to go here twice in 3 days! Bun Bo hue here is so delicious too! Love this mom n pops shop

I originally was going to give this place a nice review because our dine in experience was fairly good however we ordered a pho to go and when we got home to eat it found a mill worm in the pho! I have never been so grossed out. Immediately dumped out the rest. Will not be returning.

I only like Pho broth a a few places. We decided to try this place and got Pho Tom (shrimp) with the beef broth. It was incredibly good and is in my top 3 Pho places now. We will definitely become regulars here. My only suggestion is that they need new menus. The current ones don't have numbers and there are things that are handwritten.

The only reason I am giving this place three stars is because of the service. It was super bad that the group next to us just walked out and left. There were only two teenage girls working, one guy, and one lady at the cash register. It was super unprofessional and the two teenage girls kept walking back and fourth to clean tables when they should have a cart for cleaning everything all at once to make it easier for their part. It took forever to get seated when there were many open spots. Overall, They should train their servers a little better.

Really enjoyed my meal here, will definitely be back.  Most flavorful pho broth I've ever tasted, a rich yellow color, and piping hot.  It was not too oily at all, a very light broth with a light amount of natural fat.  That little bit of oil is FLAVOR, it's a good thing, and fat is very healthy for you.  But this is nothing like ramen broth, so if you hate heavy broth, don't worry.  It is a good level of salty, too, so remember to drink lots of water for the rest of the day.

Way more meat than I expected, too, very happy about that.  I was actually unable to finish my bowl, the size is huge.  My husband couldn't finish either.  I was full for hours.  By the way, a pot of tea is complimentary.  Service is fast and friendly.

Although it was empty when we first got in for early lunch, it was super slammed, with people waiting for tables, when we left, so if you're in a hurry you may want to time your visit at an off-hour.

Amazing! Had the pork banh mi, rare steak pho and the BBQ pork vermicelli. Wow! Best Vietnamese food I've had in Vegas hands down!!! Even received an order of free springs rolls. Delish! We will definitely be going back again and again.
Perfect meal. Not so crowded for lunch time. All our favorite food chicken pho, spring rolls and sandwiches. Fast service with nice smile

This is very good, I loved the pho just how I like it, it really had a good bone broth not just watered down I e been getting pho I. Los Angeles for years now I have two favorite spots and I like to go and try different places but this was my favorite in Las Vegas for sure if I visit again this will be a spot to visit.
