So impressed with this place! The broth is very flavorful, didn't need much hoisin sauce or hot sauce. And the meat to noodle ratio is on point! They definitely don't skimp out on the meat, from quality and quantity.

The service is good, they refill our water glasses constantly. Only gripe is they put a ton of ice in your iced coffee. But this is truly a hidden gem!

Love the decor and clean restaurant.  The staffs were nice and attentive.  This rating is strictly on the service.  It's definitely the first pho spot that would come by to check on you, refill your water and ask if you want more veggies for your pho.

Out of the 8 pho spots we had been to since November 2016.  I would have to say, it's the best one so far.  It's not the best pho though.  I'm not sure what it's missing in the broth...but it's flavorful, just not the full pho flavor.  I would give it a 2.5 stars for the pho quality.  The other pho places I give it a 0 star.    

Hopefully, we're able to find the one soon. =)

We were greeted upon arrival, we were the only people in there at the time, our greeter was very kind and gave us some jasmine tea(on the house) and ice water. She was very helpful, allowing us to switch the pork for chicken in our spring rolls, I don't eat red meat, and even recommended the chicken pho- which was delicious!!! We also got the charbroiled chicken sandwich and she went out of her way to ask if we wanted it spicy as she saw me load my rolls with hot peppers. My boyfriend got p9 pho thin sliced rare steak- he had nothing but good things to say about it. We got more than we could handle and the portions were big. Most definitely a wonderful place to visit. Very attentive service and great food!

Excellent pho, excellent service, excellent price and friendly employees!
Wish they had a place like that in Los Angeles because I would eat there all the the time.

Greasy pho broth!

I had high expectations of this place but when our bowls came out, there was a layer of greasy hanging on the top of the bowls. The flavor was ooookkk but the grease lined up lips as I was eating and that's just super gross. The noodles had a hard time separating (they were probably either old noodles or cooked way too early and just sat there). 

I had P10 which was the rare state and flank or brisket and the meat was nothing out of the ordinary but was slightly more chewy than usual. The size was average for a medium bowl but I wasn't sure I wanted more with all that grease haha. 

Go to Pho Kim Long... I know sorta overplayed and potentially getting worse from when it was really good back in the day but you won't regret it. I also sorta like how Pho Kim Long has better decor and makes me still think im in a vegas hotel.
Great pho and very nice staff! They have a kid's size bowl available and it looked like enough for an adult.

Why the pho does this place have 4.5 stars average? I was brought here under that pretense. Maybe my taste buds have been damaged by the desert heat. I mean, there's nothing majorly wrong with this place, but several small things added up dropped this down to a 3 star max.

Came in on a weeknight, and only a few tables were taken. As we entered, a young lady pointed us to a table in the back, when the owner walked by and pointed at another table and said "sit there!" We complied. We decided on some grilled meat dishes, but was warned that it would take longer, about 15 minutes. Being hungry, we changed one of our orders to pho hoping to get some food in our mouths sooner. Immediately, the owner looked impatient as he said "OK, what number do you want?" We ended up ordering a shrimp pho and a grilled pork w vermicelli.

I also wanted a smoothie, when the owner said " You know what's better? water. It cools you down and has no sugar."  Uh ... what? This is the first time ever a business tried to talk me out of ordering something extra. So I got water. 

Out of curiosity, I timed our orders (since he warned us of the delay) The pho, which usually takes about 5 minutes at every other pho place I've been to, took almost 15 min. and the pork & vermicelli came out shortly after. So ... they're both delayed, no difference. Perhaps he should have said, " we're slow here so watch our endless Bruno Mars videos that we're streaming off YouTube." They didn't even have the decency to skip the ads. The few other tables there already got their food, so we weren't sure what would cause the delay. 

The flavor of both were so average, nothing stood out. The best parts of the experience, we were no longer hungry and the owner saved me a few bucks by talking me out of ordering a smoothie. Only when we're about to leave did the owner smiled a bit and spoke a few extra words to us. Nope ... not planning on coming back. This place is a 2.5

Warning: The parking here absolutely sucks.

After few days of really bad eating and drinking on vacation in Sin City, who doesn't need pho?!  Comfort food, miss home, need pho badly fix! I always need one, me & my other half. 

After gambling later than usual in Downtown Las Vegas, I wanted to go back to my go to pho place but they closed at 9 pm. Thank you to Yelp search, this business popped up with a 4 star ratings. After looking at photos and reading a few reviews- I made up my mind and its Pho 90 for sure. 

Located in Las Vegas' beautiful Chinatown, on Spring Mountain Rd. It wasn't hard to find at 11 pm at night. They are located in the corner of this complex with many other shops. There are lots of parking for everyone. The restaurant is very new, clean, and welcoming!! I love the feel of this place. Pho 90 just opened ending of December and I am happy to see such high ratings for this place. 

The waiter dropped off our menu, I looked thru the menu and everything sounds good. I had to get my pho and I want to try everything else on the menu. It took me awhile to decide until I finally made my decision and place my order with the waiter. I had to decide on what to get for my other half. Our orders: 1 large chicken pho, 1 large beef ball pho, grilled pork banh mi, & a pot of hot jasmine tea.

Note: it is 2.00 for pot of tea. The waiter dropped off water and tea, I like the cute little tea pot and tea cups, and a basket filled with our utensils. ( what a cute idea) Our vegetables came out with my steamed bean sprouts per request. Then our piping hot bowls of pho comes out. I can see the steam, smell the nice aroma of pho, the broth looks nice and clear. I am loving it!! We both sample our soup and wow, the soup is just perfect. It was very flavorful and light. The portions are huge. We put in our veggies, lime, spices, and made out sauces ready. I gave some of my chicken to my other half and he gave me some of his beef balls. We made our own chicken and meatball pho combo. We are ready to eat! 
Oh my...... this is some good pho and it really hit the spot. The chicken is very tender and fresh.
The beef ball are home made, not packaged meat balls. We are very impressed!! We really enjoyed our pho and only 8.50 for a large bowl of pho, can't beat that price back in Honolulu. 

As we were enjoying our Pho, our grilled pork banh mi came out later. I shared this with my other half. The banh mi is huge and they sure filled up the banh mi with lots of grilled pork and veggies. I love how the veggie is cut so fancy. The French bread is toasted to perfection and wow, I really loved everything about it. It sure did come out spicy, I recall the nice aunty asked if I wanted our banh mi spicy. I was already full but I really loved my pho and banh mi, I just wanted to finish it up. 

As we were dining the couple next to us, discovered this place on Yelp as well. They mentioned that they enjoyed their food. I also had the opportunity to talk to the owner. Aunty came out and we started a conversation. She is so sweet. One question, I asked her, "what is the meaning of Pho 90"?  A favorite number and its a tradition for restaurant owners to do this.  

Another thing great about this place, they open early and close later, midnight on weekdays and 2:00 am on weekends. Perfect for very late dining. 

I remember Aunty said her son's name is Kevin but he wasn't there that day. I read about his excellent customer service skills in a few reviews. 

Come check out Pho 90!! 
We will be back for sure on my next visit to Sin City!!

#16/100 for 2017

We visited vegas from San Diego and made a stop at this pho joint since it's opened late. We didn't have high expectations for Vietnamese food in vegas but the food exceeded our expectations.  
The pho broth was pretty good. Seems authentic and fresh compared to other pho joints that I've been to.
The bbq pork was great because it has the grill scent and seemed fresh . The accompanied fish Sauce really enhanced the rice dish.
Would definitely come back

Our server was very kind and sweet especially to my two year old. She was quick to serve us and bring out our pho which tasted great. Broth was amazing. Cheap prices and they even have a kid pho bowl which you never see anywhere. Not from Vegas but will definitely be hitting up this gem everytime I visit.

- Location: 5 min from LV blvd. 
- Cleanness: Very clean! Surprised! Yes this Vietnamees resturant is very clean!
- Service: Excellent! Very kind and kept asking us if we need us more vegies and others.
- Taste: Better and very clean taste of soup. Better than the one near by my house.
- Price: Two thumbs up!

* Giving this unknown small Vietnameese Pho place is pleasure of finding of treasure! If I have chance to visit LV, definitly will come back here.

Came here the other day for a quick bite. Walked in and was immediately greeted by the server and was seated. (Although they were pretty slow, it was nice to have prompt service)

The place was neat and clean for the most part

Probably the bird or fourth time having pho but this was my favorite. I can't recall the name of the dish but the broth was flavorful and the noodles were cooked perfectly. I added extra bean sprouts, lemon and sriracha, which balances everything out nicely. 

Server  was nice and very quick as I've mentioned before. 

I'll def be back when the pho craving hits
I love their clear noodle soup and spring rolls is made fresh to order. One of my favorite place to eat

Come here for quality, well priced and traditional Vietnamese cuisine; delicious Pho!!!!
Not too much more to say. It's damn good. Lol

I went to Pho 90 last Saturday. It was a wonderful experience! The Pho I ordered came with generous amount of beef. The broth was very tasty and authentic. The price is very reasonable comparing with the ones in L.A. Really loved it! If you are a fan of Pho, you have to try it! :)

I think this is the absolute best bowl of pho I have ever had.  The smell was amazing and the flavor did not disappoint.  The noodles were perfect both in consistency & portion size.  I got the steak & brisket option (I'm not very adventurous with my beef) and I could not be happier I came here over the other options.

Postmate this place straight to my hotel (cosmo). They forgot my pho soup and I totally needed it because it was New Years morning and I was super hanging from the night before. I called them and she said to reorder and will refund the order and the previous order. I ended up not re ordering buy that was nice of her . All the food was really good. I got to try the bun bo hue which was really good and the charbroiled pork.

This place was overall terrible. My husband ordered a large rare steak and meatball pho and I ordered the bun bo. His pho had no rare steak at all and they tried to charge him $4 extra dollars and claimed he ordered an XL bowl. He barely ate half of the bowl! My bun bo came with no veggies and when I asked for veggies, they gave me cabbage and mint.. (not the right veggies to go with bun bo) The bun bo came with all the wrong meats. It's supposed to come with a slow cooked stewed beef shank but all I got was a bunch of slices of flank steak that usually goes in pho. 

On top of everything the owner was very rude when I addressed the issue with her and she yelled at the server and walked away without completing ringing us up. She yelled at the woman in Vietnamese not knowing that I understood every word. 

This place is not good and overpriced. Save your money and go somewhere else.

Our server My is the best, she made sure we had water every 5 minutes and gave us great service. Very friendly and the area is clean. Came here for a late dinner crave and glad I chose to come here instead of the place next door. The food was delicious and gave us foodgasms lol
I would definitely recommend this place and try the grilled BBQ pork vermicelli or #01 
The pho is also good.
We all ordered smoothies with jello and the green tea is out of this world.
I'm definitely coming back here for more!
The prices are perfect and it's a nice quiet place to come with friends for lunch or dinner.

Yelp suggested Pho 90 in the area, and we weren't disappointed! Quaint place with hot and cold pho, rice plates, appetizers and selection of iced coffee and fruit drinks. 

Our server was "Caiden". Amazing how Caiden wore many hats - from being our host, server, handling our to-go box, check and not to mention, the great hospitality. My Mom is fairly picky with her pho, and she enjoyed and loved the place. Fresh ingredients and wonderful service! We'll definitely return to try other items on the menu.

New place, just opened about 2 months ago. It's centrally located on Spring Mountain Road. Parking is shared with other business. 

The restaurant is very clean. We didn't have much of a wait on a Tuesday around 1:30pm. They have 3 flat screen TVs and plenty of seating. 

We ordered pho with rare steak and meatballs. The broth was SUPER TASTY and they are generous with their noodles! Their regular size looked like a large!

Our waitress was really nice. I am happy to try this place, and glad there wasn't much of a wait.

Good menu. Great tasting food. Only lacked in environment, gets cramped and parking is tight.
No smoothies here said they have them on the menu, but server said the no longer want to make anymore smoothies. Prolly won't eat here Again.
If your a college kid, this is not so bad.

Just a few annoying things made this not a good experience.  I wanted to order a delivery, but it would have taken an hour.  So I drove.  Knowing that Pho is one of those things that's ready really fast. Even in the busiest restaurants. 
I was THE ONLY customer.  That's alarming, but fine.  My food took close to 45 minutes to be handed to me.  Outrageous.  I also ordered egg rolls.  The pic showed them with the pickled veggies.  I asked the girl who worked there if they'll be served with the lettuce leaves to wrap them.  She said yes.  Funny enough, all I got was the lettuce. No mint, no basil, no pickled veggies.  I also paid for extra broth.  Sadly, I didn't get that either. I also asked for Nuoc Beo.  Although she was not Vietnamese, she assured me that she knew what it was and that I'll get some.  There was none.  Didn't enjoy the soup or the egg rolls because of missing items and ate too late.  One compliment and I guess an important one.  The broth was good.

Like a small mom and pop Vietnamese place, fairly small place. The service was  good and the food was pretty good with flavors popping. Not exactly as good as Los Angeles but the flavors were spot on but the price to portion a bit smaller than what I'm used to. The portion was a bit small compared to what they charged for the BBQ pork place. Instead of an egg omelet they have a eggs over ex on top of the rice dish. The spring rolls were good. 

Next time I'll try the pho and the Bahn mi.

One waitress on the floor with several tables.
She forgot to bring the drink then asked her again but she didn't serve. So I walked to the counter one more time but she just work ignoring our drink. After we finished our soup, we were so thirsty then asked another guy then we got drink. 
So horrible service.
Just as expected! It was fantastic. Small joint but they do the work. Our bhan mi and Pho was amazing - our bill was under $15!!! Will certainly be returning.

The service and taste of the pho just isn't the same as it used to be the first few months after they opened.

Don't know what changed :(

I made a yelp specifically to review this place so I really hope this gets posted...

FOOD: MEDIOCRE 
SERVICE: UTTERLY HORRIBLE

Whoever is running this establishment knows NOTHING about about customer service.

My group arrived at 10:30, was seated at 11 (the wait for a table was understandable) and waited for someone to tend to our table for 15 minuets... we did not even get waters... after a waiter finally came to take our order, we noticed groups that arrived after us were getting their food while all we had were empty water cups. 

FINALLY at 11:57 (an entire hour after we were seated) after every other group in the restaurant received their food, we asked to cancel two of our orders because two people out of our group could not eat meat on Sunday (aka in 3 minutes) and the staff said they were unable to substitute any meat for tofu. After those two people in our party left because they were unable to eat ANYTHING, the last 4 of us waited ANOTHER 15 minutes for our pho to come out (which was not even hot btw???). We did not even receive the 1 pork banh mi we ordered until we asked where it was, and even then they gave us the wrong order and served us a BEFF banh mi!!!!! 

The staff did not even know how to apologize properly, or even provide better service. They just kept trying to blame everything on the kitchen staff. At least refill the empty water cups!

At the very least those two kids working the front of the house need to be fired or trained properly because I have NEVER been to an establishment this unprofessional/confused before. Everything mentioned in this review was LESS THAN HALF of the horrible service we experienced. 

NEVER COME TO THIS PLACE UNLESS YOU LIKE TO STARVE AND GET SERVED COLD FOOD AND THE WRONG ORDERS

VERY impressed with the food and service. Servers were attentive and the food was great! I came here on a whim craving late night pho but didn't feel like going to the usual pho kim long and if you ever find yourself doing craving the same, come here instead!
I was headed to pho kim long and seen the line and found this great place. Amazing customer service, very attentive. Clean. And the food is amazing.

Great customer service + great sandwiches! 

I tried the combination pho. It wasn't anything extraordinary to me but it didn't lack flavor. I also tried the BBQ pork bahn mi & it was amazing! It took awhile for the sandwich to come out but it was well worth it. The bread was toasty but not too crunchy that it cuts the roof of your mouth (like other bahn mi's I've tried) it literally melted in my mouth! Thinking about it right now is making me crave for this sandwich. I'll come again for the sandwich!!

My new pho spot in Vegas! At first, no one was there to greet us and take us to a table so we just sat down at one. Our waitress was very nice. The broth was delicious. While we were eating our pho, the place got really hot. They probably didn't turn on the A/C. Other than that, not a bad place.

Quick service, great attention, AWESOME food. The Pho was exquisite. Greatly recommended! I went with my husband and sister, and the 3 of us ordered the P1 and the spring rolls, and were not disappointed.

I was super stoked when this place opened up because not only was it new, there were some rave reviews. Unfortunately, I wasn't too stoked about the pho broth. The presentation is cute though, I love how they laid out their egg rolls. 

I haven't been back since for a reason. I may have gone on their off day, as they had just opened when I had visited.
The pho dac viet was very flavorful. The bun bo hue was delicious as well. Portions were large and the service was excellent. Highly recommend
I'm from oc california.  Can't compare but this place is good enough.  The best part is they have red pepper flake chili oil.

Lady was very sweet she gave us a coconut drink for the inconvenience of a ugly Critter come into our table & this nasty little cockroaches staring at our Face. 
Besides all that the food was just OK .
Super good broth, excellent flavor. Prices and sizes of Pho have changed from yelp pics of the menu, but still totes worth it. Trying the sammies next time. 10/10 will return!

Pho 90 should be renamed to Pho 100 because they're definitely 100% a 5 star restaurant. Literally, I've received some of the best service here, on multiple occasions, even far beyond the call of duty.

Every time I've been here they've always been welcoming and helpful. Very attentive and fast service. They bring everything to your table once you order so you don't ask for much. They're a smaller spot so it does get full pretty fast. 

The prices are reasonable and the portions even better. Flavor of the pho broth is delicious (usually get pho tai) and the grilled meat with the cold noodle (bun-tuc-nun, idk the spelling) is the best I've ever had in town. The way they cook it is on a certain fire grill and it's seriously sooo good like you just cooked it straight from the backyard BBQ.

There have been a couple times where I've ordered on the phone for pick up. There was one time in specific where I ordered ahead, picked it up, went to work, and had realized they had given me the order. Because I didn't have time to do anything about it I just figured I'd eat what I had. They ended up calling me back and apologized, they wanted to bring me the right order because they knew I was going to work, I told them that it was okay and they insisted on coming by, and even let me keep the wrong order... seriously no one does that and I don't think places would ever do that, but they did. They truly exceed my expectations every time and deserve all the amazing reviews they receive. 

My go to pho spot!

Checking this new Pho place out that opened next to Kaya sushi.  I always like to try new pho places to see who has the best broth.  This place is very good and their pho tai hit the spot.  

Also ordered Bun Bo Hue and this is the only place in Vegas that ive seen that includes pigs blood ( a normal item traditionally found in bun bo hue) in theirs.  

The place was very clean with simple decor.  Nice and cozy.  

The service was on point. The server (i believe his name is Kevin was very courteous and knowledgeable about the menu.  He was nice enough to bring some different sauces for us to try.  He was awesome and informed us that they will be adding more things on the menu in the near future.  

Try this place out.  I'll be sure to be back next time I want some pho in the chinatown area.
It's nice place, great service, very clean.Pho with rare steak, beef balls are very delicious . I love this place. I will come back.if you come in town . I recommend you should come to Pho 90

Great service and awesome food! The guy was very funny and kept the little one entertained every time he was serving us. I could not think of anything that went wrong... definitely will come again, awesome time!

Good Pho! I had the Pho Dac Bit (large) and ingredients were fresh and soup was delicious! The staff were friendly and courteous, they kept checking on me to make sure everything was ok. I also had the Thai Tea, which was delicious! 
This place is tucked away in the shopping mall and a corner unit! Small, but good place for fresh and we'll cooked Pho!
It was first time having Pho and it was amazing. I've never thought something could be so good and filling
